title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 175.1 - Introduction and objective
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 175.1 - Introduction and objective

State Regulations
(a) The
objective of the Syracuse Regional Airport Authority (SRAA) rules and
regulations governing commercial ground transportation at Syracuse Hancock

International Airport (airport) is to promote high quality ground
transportation operations consistent with public safety and convenience, and to
ensure a high level of airport customer service in the movement of passengers
to and from the airport. (b) The
following categories of commercial ground transportation services are governed
by these rules and regulations: (1)
taxicab
services; (2)
transportation
charter party (TCP) carriers including limousines, SUVs, vans, and
buses; (3)
courtesy vehicles
including those operated by rental car, hotel/motel, off-airport parking, and
institutional (
e.g., school) operators; (4)
nonprofit services including
publicly-owned transit; (5)
transportation network companies; and
(6)
airport rental car
concessionaires. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
175.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
